events.originalText: A gunman carried out a shooting spree in Cumbria, England, killing 12 people and injuring 11 others before committing suicide.
events.subtitle: Cumbria shootings
events.headline: Gunman kills 12 in shooting spree in Cumbria, England

events.originalText: Bosnian War: U.S. Air Force captain Scott O'Grady was shot down while patrolling the NATO no-fly zone over Bosnia, but ejected safely and was rescued six days later.
events.subtitle: Bosnian War
events.headline: U.S. Air Force captain Scott O'Grady shot down over Bosnia

events.originalText: The Royal Air Force suffered its worst peacetime disaster when a Chinook helicopter crashed on the Mull of Kintyre in Scotland, killing all 29 people on board.
events.subtitle: Royal Air Force
events.headline: Chinook helicopter crash in Scotland kills 29 on board

events.originalText: After an emergency landing due to an in-flight fire, 23 passengers aboard Air Canada Flight 797 were killed when a flashover occurred as the aircraft's doors opened.
events.subtitle: Emergency landing
events.headline: 23 killed in Air Canada Flight 797 flashover incident

events.originalText: Benno Ohnesorg, a German university student, was killed in West Berlin while protesting against the visit of Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi of Iran; the anarchist militant 2 June Movement was later named after the incident.
events.subtitle: Killing of Benno Ohnesorg
events.headline: German student Benno Ohnesorg killed in West Berlin protest

events.originalText: The USSR and Yugoslavia sign the Belgrade declaration, legitimising different intepretations of Marxism in non-Soviet countries.
events.subtitle: Belgrade declaration
events.headline: USSR and Yugoslavia sign Belgrade declaration on Marxism

events.originalText: Queen Elizabeth II (pictured) was crowned at Westminster Abbey in London.
events.subtitle: Elizabeth II
events.headline: Queen Elizabeth II crowned at Westminster Abbey in London

events.originalText: First Red Scare: The anarchist followers of Luigi Galleani (pictured) set off eight bombs in eight cities across the United States.
events.subtitle: First Red Scare
events.headline: Luigi Galleani followers set off bombs in First Red Scare

events.originalText: The wedding of Grover Cleveland and Frances Folsom took place in the White House, the only time a U.S. president used that building for the ceremony.
events.subtitle: Wedding of Grover Cleveland and Frances Folsom
events.headline: Grover Cleveland weds Frances Folsom in White House ceremony

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: A Franco-Spanish fleet recaptured the British-held Diamond Rock, an uninhabited island at the entrance to the bay leading to Fort-de-France, Martinique.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: Franco-Spanish fleet recaptures Diamond Rock from British

events.originalText: Henry Hacking killed the Aboriginal Australian resistance fighter Pemulwuy after Philip Gidley King ordered that he be brought in dead or alive.
events.subtitle: Henry Hacking
events.headline: Aboriginal Australian resistance fighter Pemulwuy killed by Henry Hacking

events.originalText: After having removed Petronius Maximus from the imperial throne, Vandals led by Genseric entered Rome and began sacking the city for two weeks.
events.subtitle: Petronius Maximus
events.headline: Vandals sack Rome after removing Petronius Maximus from throne
